data.title: USU Portrait Collection
data.meta_description: Archives West provides access to descriptions of primary sources in the western United States, including correspondence, diaries, and photographs. Digital reproductions of primary sources are available in some cases. Archives West was formerly known as the Northwest Digital Archives (NWDA).
data.text:
The USU Portraits collection contains over 10,000 portraits of USU students, faculty, and staff from 1951-2003. The collection is mostly made up of prints, but features several hundred negatives as well, though this is inconsistent.

Restrictions on Use

It is the responsibility of the researcher to obtain any necessary copyright clearances.

Permission to publish material from the USU Portrait Collection must be obtained from the Photographs Curator and/or the Special Collections Department Head.

Preferred Citation

Initial Citation: USU Portrait Collection, USU_P0633. Special Collections and Archives. Utah State University Merrill-Cazier Library. Logan, Utah.

Following Citations:USU_P0633, USUSCA.
